title: le mail inviate vanno a finire , al destinatario , per lo piu' nei loro spam.
content: non riusciamo a risolvere il fatto che mandando una mail il destinatario il piu' delle volte gli va a finire nello spam. grazie
creator: amministrazione56

title: Make firefox (linux, snap) mouse pointer adhere to system settings
content:
I have recently updated to Xubuntu 22 and in the process my firefox was migrated to the snap version. Now firefox is using its own mouse pointer style (smaller pointer, "hand with cuff pointing left" instead of "hand pointing up" over links). I can edit the system style of my mouse pointer, but that does not change the mouse pointer while in Firefox. This seems the same problem like these two questions: - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1380997 - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1369875

How do I make Firefox use the system settings for the mouse pointer? Or at least how do I change the mouse pointer style/settings for Firefox snap at all?

For reference my Firefox Version is 104.0.2 (64-bit) Mozilla Firefox Snap for Ubuntu. My desktop environment is xfce 4.16.

Thanks, Peter
creator: peter-lyko

title: NO sound (firefox 105.0b9)  but OK width  (firefox 104.0.2)
content: bold text Bonjour, J'ai un montage avec du son qui fonctionnait avant les dernières mises à jour de Firefox. J'essaye aujourd'hui et le son ne passe pas avec Firefox développer 105.0b9, Mais c'est OK avec Firefox 104.0.2. De même nous avons des problème d'affichage : pages qu'il faut zoomer à 80%, alors que la police des menus est minuscule. Merci de votre attention. Yves
creator: riribouldingue

title: certain web pages broken after upgrade to Ubuntu 22.04.1 'jellyfish' LTS
content:
Immediately after OS upgrade to Ubuntu 22.04.1 'jellyfish' LTS, I started having multiple problems with 'random' web pages. So far, each site with problems loads fine with Chromium. I have attached 2 screenshots to show one specific problem - a Kaiser sign in page. with firefox, I have double braces, double colons and seemingly variable names filling an unresponsive page. While with Chromium, Sign In works normally.

on another specific site, the FireFox sign in is successful, but the welcome page stays completely blank, so no navigation is possible. In other sites, the gray revolving circle goes on forever. And for most sites everything is fine. I am starting here as the problem is manifesting in FireFox, but may be the OS ? my version of FireFox is 104.0.2 (64-bit) [Sep. 6th, 2022 ?]

So, How to triage whether this is an OS problem or a FireFox issue ? What info do I need to collect ?

thank you for your help on this.
creator: kanka66

title: Cannot delete Firefox account, states "Wrong Password"
content:
Let's get the obvious out of the way:

  • Yes, I know my password
  • Yes, I can log in with that password
  • No, I am not logged in anywhere else, I signed out using the account tool

I have a firefox account tied to an email that I want to use again for a NEW firefox account. I attempted to delete the account @ https://accounts.firefox.com/settings/delete_account.

When on step 1, I check all of the boxes, Continue, enter in the correct password, it states: "Incorrect password".

How can I correct this? I want to delete this account and start over, I don't want to use a different email.
creator: jrofx

title: Unable to access merchant website
content: I was in my account on walmart.com earlier today. When I next tried to access it I was unable to get into the website using Firefox. Even if I simply type "walmart.com", it takes me to the log-in page but it doesn't allow me to log in. I can't even browse their website in Firefox. I restarted my computer (desktop), but that didn't help. I have always used Firefox to access Walmart. I tried my other browsers, and they work fine.
creator: jjii

title: How to hide "Shot Copied" Notification PERMANATELY when taking screenshots?
content:
This is a duplicate problem of [[this post|https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1237229]], however the chosen answer is silly and not practical to implement because it requires a setting change after every restart. Yeah I'll try to remember to do that.... NOT!

I have dom.webnotifications.enabled set to false but these annoying notifications still appear. They require user intervention to close. I don't fing want notifications about anything, much less that I screenshotted something. Please tell me how to get rid of this crap so I don't have to download a third party add-on.
creator: gsrgtrdg4565653

title: Disable keyboard shortcut Command-Shift-Delete
content: Is there a way to disable the keyboard shortcut Command-Shift-Delete on MacBook so it doesn't open the clear cache dialogue box? I use this keyboard shortcut all the time to empty my trash; I've occasionally accidentally triggered it in Firefox when I was really just trying to empty my trash.
creator: kazu28403

title: Firefox latest update forgot all previous tabs and no menu options are accessible
content: After the latest update none of my previous tabs showed up and no menu options are ever available. Usually searches never start. How do I recover?
creator: BrysonT

title: creating a outlook email account
content: I'm hoping Firefox can help my problem? I have Outlook email account that I just started using. But, I'm trying to create more than one outlook email account. When I try and create another outlook account I find the instructions for it, but those instructions don't seem to relate to my Firefox browser? The instructions ask for me to click on the file tab to create another outlook account, which I can see on the screen shot provided. But, the Firefox file tab has not link that provides that to happen. So, I'm wondering if I need another browser, a different browser to create another outlook account? Sounds rather confusing to me? But, when it's all said and done, can I create a second or more outlook account with Firefox? It seems difficult for me to do so with Firefox? Can someone please help and explain if I can create another new outlook account with Firefox, and I can, how do I do that? Thank you.
creator: sciencemagic
